main event: On February 7, 1969, a bright stationary light was observed in Fairfax, Virginia, suspected to be a hot air balloon.
interesting points: The light was approximately 30 to 40 degrees above the horizon and was seen for about 90 seconds,The light appeared to pulsate between a very bright white and a dim reddish-orange,The object was estimated to be 5 to 10 miles away and roughly 1.5 times the apparent diameter of the full moon,No noise was reported during the observation,There was a conclusion that it resembled past sightings of Garment Bag Hot Air Balloons.
witness description: Raymond W. Oven, a mechanical engineer, and Steven J. Hanson, his colleague.
